column1: problem statement:   Read assignment  1) Read Textbook Chapter 6 : Sun Synchronous [ read for comprehension, but no problem sets assigned on this chapter ]   2) Begin your project!   Read sections 1-3 of CubeSat 101 : Basic Concepts and Processes for first time Cubesat developers.  [ already uploaded to Background module ].   Now, consider a novel space mission [ or an extension of an existing mission ] that sparks your interest: commercial, research/exploratory, defense, etc.  Keep the scope reasonable.   Follow the CubeSat 101 process and create a first draft outline [ sections: Intro, Process, Mission Models] that would serve to describe the Cubesat [ as you'll see - there are many configurations possible] with sufficient detail that might attract funding.      If you have any preliminary ideas, that you'll like show me early on, please do!     ** this project will be worth 200 pts total.  The outline is the first increment, worth 50 pts, to augmented the remainder of the Cubesat 101 sections later.

column4: Radiation-tolerant edge AI computer performing autonomous vision/control tasks in orbit to validate radiation mitigation and onboard intelligence
column5: Radiation-tolerant RISC-V AI computer running onboard vision/controls with live fault injection

column4: 6U CubeSat that 3D prints and tests small truss elements in microgravity to demonstrate in-space additive manufacturing feasibility
column5: Microgravity 3D printing + mechanical testing of structural coupons in 6U CubeSat

column4: CubeSat that deploys and phases segmented mirrors to validate active optics control for future large telescopes
column5: Segmented mirror + MEMS deformable mirror phasing for 30 cm effective aperture

column4: X-ray pulsar navigation demonstrator showing autonomous position estimation in space using compact timing detectors
column5: Compact X-ray pulsar navigation pathfinder using silicon detector and onboard timing

column4: Store-and-forward intersatellite networking experiment demonstrating Delay-Tolerant Networking between CubeSats
column5: Delay-Tolerant Networking with inter-sat store-and-forward routing between CubeSats

column4: CubeSat demonstrator for Mars-Earth communications using optical inter-satellite links and deep-space transponder emulation in LEO
column5: First CubeSat-scale deep-space optical comms terminal; LEO emulation of Mars-relay links for DSN-like ground integration

column4: Miniaturized Langmuir probe and magnetometer mission to measure ionospheric plasma density and address NOAA’s observation gap
column5: COTS plasma diagnostics (Langmuir + magnetometer) providing low-cost ionospheric density profiles

column4: SWIR imaging mission detecting lithium-bearing mineral signatures as an analog for asteroid resource prospecting
column5: SWIR mineral spectral detection tuned to lithium-bearing signatures; asteroid-resource sensor analog over Earth

column4: LEO-to-ground optical downlink experiment testing adaptive optics receivers and smart communication protocols
column5: Adaptive-optics downlink testbed focusing on AO receiver + protocol design

column4: Rendezvous and proximity-ops demonstrator using angles-only vision-based navigation with a tethered passive target
column5: Angles-only vision-based rendezvous with tethered passive target

column4: 3U CubeSat generating and transmitting entangled photons between space and ground to demonstrate secure quantum key distribution
column5: 3U CubeSat generating and transmitting entangled photons to demonstrate secure quantum-resilient communications

column4: Quantum random number generator satellite producing verifiable randomness beacons for secure communication research
column5: Quantum Random Number Generator in orbit producing open verifiable randomness beacons
